page.title: 02Skibo and Clashmore Cont
page.content: The castle has formal gardens, a big walled kitchen garden and extensive glasshouses. The grounds are opened to the public on 2 days in July each year. The whole area shows the character of the estate and many of the people are employees or tenants of it. The fine village hall was gifted by Andrew Carnegie. The village shop/PO is now only a tea room. some crofts and 2 farms, Pulrossie and Overskibo, lie to the W and Cyderhall Farm to the SE. The land slopes to the S and enjoys a good climate. There are many beautiful trees.
